pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
That function is definitely defined in `src/Plugin.cc`, so this strikes me as a linker error. I'd say that maybe we're neglecting to link the `ignition-common0` library to the `INTEGRATION_plugin` test, but that test is built using `ign_build_tests(~)`, and it very clearly calls `target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} ... ${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER})`, where `${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER}` is equivalent to the main library's target name.

I genuinely don't know what could cause this, short of a peculiar bug in our cmake script that only shows up on Mac.
content.html:
That function is definitely defined in src/Plugin.cc, so this strikes me as a linker error. I'd say that maybe we're neglecting to link the ignition-common0 library to the INTEGRATION_plugin test, but that test is built using ign_build_tests(~), and it very clearly calls target_link_libraries(${BINARY_NAME} ... ${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER}), where ${PROJECT_NAME_LOWER} is equivalent to the main library's target name.

I genuinely don't know what could cause this, short of a peculiar bug in our cmake script that only shows up on Mac.
